commands.name: workspace/tree
commands.description: Tree command parameters

commands.name: workspace/task/list
commands.description: Queries the task queue with filters for assignee, status, domain, task type, and context, returning matching tasks with priority-sorted results and aggregate statistics.

commands.name: workspace/task/create
commands.description: Creates a new task and assigns it to a PersonaUser, specifying domain, type, priority, optional deadline, dependencies, and a human-readable description of the work to be done.

commands.name: workspace/task/complete
commands.description: Marks a task as completed or failed, recording its output, error details, and performance metrics such as tokens used, latency, and confidence.

commands.name: workspace/recipe/load
commands.description: Loads recipe JSON files from system/recipes/*.json into database

commands.name: workspace/list
commands.description: List all persona workspaces across the team — worktree paths, git branches, modified files, shell activity. Scans both in-memory active workspaces and persisted git worktrees on disk.

commands.name: workspace/git/workspace/init
commands.description: Initialize git workspace for persona collaboration with isolated worktree

commands.name: workspace/git/workspace/clean
commands.description: Clean up git workspace and remove worktree

commands.name: workspace/git/status
commands.description: Show git workspace status and changes

commands.name: workspace/git/push
commands.description: Push workspace branch to remote repository

commands.name: workspace/git/commit
commands.description: Commit changes in git workspace with persona identity

commands.name: voice/transcribe
commands.description: Transcribe audio to text using Rust Whisper (STT). Wraps the streaming-core Whisper adapter for speech-to-text conversion.

commands.name: voice/synthesize
commands.description: Synthesize text to speech using Rust TTS (Kokoro primary). Wraps the streaming-core TTS adapters for text-to-speech conversion.

commands.name: voice/stop
commands.description: Stop an active voice chat session

commands.name: voice/start
commands.description: Start voice chat session for real-time audio communication with AI

commands.name: utilities/pipe/chain
commands.description: Enables Unix-style command chaining: cmd1 | cmd2 | cmd3
commands parameter

commands.name: utilities/lease/request
commands.description: Lease Request Parameters

commands.name: utilities/hello
commands.description: Simple hello world command for testing

commands.name: utilities/docs/search
commands.description: Searches across all project documentation files for lines matching a text pattern, returning matching lines with their document name, line number, and content.

commands.name: utilities/docs/read
commands.description: Reads the content of a documentation file by name, with support for table-of-contents extraction, jumping to a specific section, or reading a line range.

commands.name: utilities/docs/list
commands.description: Lists all available documentation files in the project, returning metadata such as file size, line count, section headings, and directory, with optional filtering by directory or filename pattern.

commands.name: user/get-me
commands.description: User Get Me Command - Get current user info Convenience command that returns the caller's full user information. No parameters needed - sessionId is auto-injected and used to look up user.

commands.name: user/create
commands.description: User create command parameters These are the "recipe ingredients" for user creation

commands.name: training/import
commands.description: Training Import Parameters

commands.name: theme
commands.description: Base theme parameters interface

commands.name: theme/set
commands.description: Theme set command parameters

commands.name: theme/list
commands.description: Theme list command parameters

commands.name: theme/get
commands.description: Theme get command parameters - gets current theme

commands.name: system/daemons
commands.description: List all registered system daemons with their status

commands.name: state/update
commands.description: State update command parameters

commands.name: state/get
commands.description: State get command parameters

commands.name: state/create
commands.description: State create command parameters

commands.name: state/content/switch
commands.description: Switch to an existing open content item (set as current/highlighted tab). Does NOT add to openItems - use content/open for that.

commands.name: state/content/close
commands.description: Close a content item (remove from user's open tabs). Handles currentItemId reassignment if closing the active tab.

commands.name: social/trending
commands.description: Discover trending and popular content on a social media platform. Shows hot posts, top communities, and rising discussions.

commands.name: social/signup
commands.description: Register a persona on a social media platform (e.g., Moltbook). Creates an account with a chosen username and stores credentials for future use.

commands.name: social/search
commands.description: Social Search Command Parameters

commands.name: social/propose
commands.description: Handle type for proposals

commands.name: social/profile
commands.description: View or update a social media profile. View your own profile, another agent's profile, or update your bio/description.

commands.name: social/post
commands.description: Create a post on a social media platform using the persona's stored credentials.

commands.name: social/notifications
commands.description: Check for unread notifications (replies, mentions, followers) on a social media platform. Key data source for SocialMediaRAGSource.

commands.name: social/feed
commands.description: Read the feed from a social media platform. Supports global feed, personalized feed, and community-specific feeds.

commands.name: social/engage
commands.description: Social Engage Command Parameters

commands.name: social/downvote
commands.description: Downvote a post on a social media platform

commands.name: social/community
commands.description: Manage communities (submolts) — create, list, subscribe, unsubscribe, get info

commands.name: social/comment
commands.description: Comment on a post or reply to a comment on a social media platform. Supports threaded replies.

commands.name: social/classify
commands.description: Timestamp of classification

commands.name: social/browse
commands.description: Social Browse Command Parameters

commands.name: skill/validate
commands.description: Validate a generated skill by running TypeScript compilation and tests in an ExecutionSandbox. Updates SkillEntity with validation results.

commands.name: skill/propose
commands.description: Propose a new skill (command) specification. Creates a SkillEntity with status 'proposed'. For team-scoped skills, creates a DecisionProposal for governance approval.

commands.name: skill/list
commands.description: List skills with optional filters by status, scope, and creator. Returns SkillEntity records from the database.

commands.name: skill/generate
commands.description: Generate code files for a proposed skill using the CommandGenerator. Retrieves the SkillEntity and produces source files.

commands.name: skill/activate
commands.description: Activate a validated skill by registering it as a live command. The skill becomes available for use by the creator (personal) or all personas (team).

commands.name: session/get-user
commands.description: Resolve a session to its owning UserEntity, defaulting to the caller's session or targeting a specific one.

commands.name: session/get-id
commands.description: Session Get ID Command - Get current session ID Convenience command that returns the caller's session ID. No parameters needed - sessionId is auto-injected by framework.

commands.name: session/destroy
commands.description: Tear down a user session and clean up all associated resources, optionally recording the reason for destruction.

commands.name: session/create
commands.description: Session create command parameters

commands.name: sentinel/status
commands.description: Check the status of a running sentinel by its handle.

commands.name: sentinel/save
commands.description: Save sentinel definitions to database for persistence and sharing.

commands.name: sentinel/run
commands.description: Run Sentinels from JSON configuration. Allows AIs to create and execute autonomous task pipelines.

commands.name: sentinel/logs/tail
commands.description: Get the last N lines of a sentinel log stream, like Unix tail.

commands.name: sentinel/logs/read
commands.description: Read a log stream for a sentinel with optional offset and limit for pagination.

commands.name: sentinel/logs/list
commands.description: List available log streams for a sentinel by handle.

commands.name: sentinel/load
commands.description: Load and optionally run saved sentinel definitions from database.

commands.name: sentinel/list
commands.description: List saved sentinel definitions from database.

commands.name: sentinel/cancel
commands.description: Cancel running sentinels by handle or filter. Supports three modes: - Direct: provide a `handle` to cancel one sentinel - Filtered: provide `type` and/or `status` to cancel matching sentinels - Default: no params cancels all running sentinels

commands.name: security/setup
commands.description: Install and configure security components (network monitor, proxy) and report their current status.

commands.name: search/vector
commands.description: Vector similarity search via Rust SearchModule

commands.name: search/params
commands.description: Get algorithm parameters from Rust SearchModule

commands.name: search/list
commands.description: Lists available search algorithms from Rust SearchModule

commands.name: search/execute
commands.description: Executes text search via Rust SearchModule

commands.name: runtime/metrics
commands.description: Query Rust module performance metrics including latency percentiles, command counts, and slow command tracking. Enables AI-driven system analysis and optimization.

commands.name: rag/load
commands.description: RAG Load Command - Test incremental message loading with token counting Shows exactly which messages would be loaded for RAG context given a token budget. Makes the incremental loading algorithm transparent and debuggable.

commands.name: rag/budget
commands.description: RAG Budget Command - Calculate token budget for RAG context Shows the algorithm for calculating safe message counts based on model's context window. Makes the token budget calculation transparent and debuggable.

commands.name: process-registry
commands.description: Cleanup processes parameters

commands.name: positron/cursor
commands.description: Enables AIs to point, highlight, and draw attention to elements in the UI. The cursor is the AI's "hand" - its spatial presence in the interface.

commands.name: ping
commands.description: Include detailed AI persona health status

commands.name: persona/learning/pattern/query
commands.description: Query the collective pattern knowledge base. Search for patterns that might help solve the current problem.

commands.name: persona/learning/pattern/endorse
commands.description: Report the outcome of using a pattern. Updates confidence scores and can trigger validation or deprecation.

commands.name: persona/learning/pattern/capture
commands.description: Capture a successful pattern for cross-AI learning. When an AI discovers a working solution, they share it with the team.

commands.name: persona/learning/multi-agent-learn
commands.description: Triggers collaborative learning across multiple PersonaUser participants after a shared activity completes, distributing reinforcement or correction training to each based on their individual performance metrics.

commands.name: persona/learning/capture-interaction
commands.description: Captures an AI persona's input/output pair during task execution, accumulating training examples in-memory for batch LoRA micro-tuning within a specified learning domain.

commands.name: persona/learning/capture-feedback
commands.description: Records a correction, approval, critique, score, or suggestion from one persona to another, enabling reciprocal learning where both the feedback giver and receiver improve from the exchange.

commands.name: persona/genome
commands.description: Get persona genome information including base model, layers, and traits

commands.name: migration/verify
commands.description: Verify migration integrity by comparing record counts between source and target

commands.name: migration/status
commands.description: Get current migration progress with per-collection breakdown

commands.name: migration/start
commands.description: Start streaming data migration between any two storage adapters (e.g., SQLite to PostgreSQL)

commands.name: migration/rollback
commands.description: Revert to the previous connection string after a cutover. Source data is never deleted.

commands.name: migration/resume
commands.description: Resume a paused migration from its last checkpoint

commands.name: migration/pause
commands.description: Pause an in-flight migration. Can be resumed later from the last checkpoint.

commands.name: migration/cutover
commands.description: Switch all operations from current adapter to the migration target. Saves previous connection for rollback.

commands.name: media/resize
commands.description: Parameters for media resizing

commands.name: media/process
commands.description: Parameters for media processing

commands.name: logs/stats
commands.description: Return aggregate statistics about all log files, including total file count and combined size in megabytes.

commands.name: logs/search
commands.description: Search across log files for lines matching a pattern, optionally scoped to specific logs, categories, or personas.

commands.name: logs/read
commands.description: Read lines from a log file with optional filtering by level or component, and optional multi-dimensional structure analysis (temporal, severity, spatial).

commands.name: logs/list
commands.description: logs/list Command Types

commands.name: logs/config
commands.description: Get or set logging configuration per persona and category

commands.name: logging/status
commands.description: Show current logging configuration for all personas or a specific persona

commands.name: logging/enable
commands.description: Enable logging for a persona. Persists to .continuum/logging.json

commands.name: logging/disable
commands.description: Disable logging for a persona. Persists to .continuum/logging.json

commands.name: list
commands.description: List command parameters

commands.name: interface/webmcp/discover
commands.description: Discover WebMCP tools available on the current page. Returns structured tool definitions with schemas. Fails explicitly if WebMCP is not available.

commands.name: interface/webmcp/call
commands.description: Call a WebMCP tool on the current page. Returns structured result from the tool. Fails explicitly if WebMCP is not available or tool not found.

commands.name: interface/web/search
commands.description: Web search parameters

commands.name: interface/web/fetch
commands.description: Web fetch parameters

commands.name: interface/wait-for-element
commands.description: Wait for a DOM element to appear, matching a CSS selector.

commands.name: interface/type
commands.description: Type text into a form field or input element.

commands.name: interface/scroll
commands.description: Scroll the page or a specific element.

commands.name: interface/screenshot
commands.description: Screenshot Command Parameters - Enhanced with advanced features

commands.name: interface/proxy-navigate
commands.description: Enables cross-origin navigation through proxy system for widget training. Solves the fundamental html2canvas + cross-origin iframe limitation.

commands.name: interface/page/submit
commands.description: Submit a form on a web page. Use interface/page/forms to discover forms, interface/page/fill to populate fields, then this command to submit. Returns the resulting page state after submission.

commands.name: interface/page/forms
commands.description: Discover all forms on a web page. Returns structured form definitions with field names, types, labels, and submit buttons. Works on ANY page with HTML forms - no WebMCP required. Use this first to understand what you can interact with, then use interface/page/fill and interface/page/submit.

commands.name: interface/page/fill
commands.description: Fill form fields on a web page. Use interface/page/forms first to discover available forms and their fields. This command fills fields but does NOT submit - use interface/page/submit after filling.

commands.name: interface/navigate
commands.description: Navigate the browser to a URL.

commands.name: interface/launch/url
commands.description: Opens a URL in the default browser. Enables personas to view what they build.

commands.name: interface/get-text
commands.description: Extract text content from a DOM element by CSS selector.

commands.name: interface/click
commands.description: Click a DOM element by CSS selector.

commands.name: interface/browser/capabilities
commands.description: Check available browser automation capabilities. Returns explicit status for each capability (webmcp, puppeteer, etc). No fallbacks - AIs see exactly what is/isn't available.

commands.name: inference/generate
commands.description: Generate text using local or cloud AI inference. Auto-routes to best available backend (Candle → Ollama → cloud). Handles model loading, LoRA adapters, and provider failover automatically.

commands.name: help
commands.description: Discover and display help documentation from command READMEs, auto-generating templates for gaps

commands.name: genome/training-pipeline
commands.description: One-command entry point for full LoRA training workflow. Builds a Sentinel pipeline that prepares data, trains adapter, registers it, and activates it for a persona

commands.name: genome/train
commands.description: Execute LoRA fine-tuning on a JSONL dataset using PEFTLoRAAdapter. Wraps trainLoRA() as a command for Sentinel pipeline orchestration

commands.name: genome/activate
commands.description: Activate adapter for persona Loads adapter into memory, evicting others if needed.

commands.name: genome/deactivate
commands.description: Deactivate adapter for persona Unloads adapter from memory.

commands.name: genome/stats
commands.description: Get genome statistics Returns global daemon stats and per-persona stats.

commands.name: genome/register
commands.description: Register persona with genome daemon Must be called before activating adapters.

commands.name: genome/unregister
commands.description: Unregister persona from genome daemon Unloads all adapters for persona.

commands.name: genome/phenotype-validate
commands.description: Genome Phenotype Validate Command Parameters

commands.name: genome/paging-unregister
commands.description: Unregister persona from genome daemon - unloads all adapters for persona.

commands.name: genome/paging-stats
commands.description: Get genome statistics - returns global daemon stats and per-persona stats.

commands.name: genome/paging-register
commands.description: Register persona with genome daemon - must be called before activating adapters.

commands.name: genome/paging-deactivate
commands.description: Deactivate adapter for persona - unloads adapter from memory.

commands.name: genome/paging-adapter-register
commands.description: Genome Paging Adapter Register Command Types Register a mock LoRA adapter in the global adapter registry. This must be done before activating adapters for personas. Phase 7: Mock adapters only Phase 8+: Real Candle adapters

commands.name: genome/paging-activate
commands.description: Activate adapter for persona - loads adapter into memory, evicting others if needed. Phase 7: Single adapter per persona (mock adapters) Phase 8+: Multiple adapters stacked (real GPU)

commands.name: genome/job-status
commands.description: GenomeJobStatusTypes - Query fine-tuning job status Retrieves current status, progress, and metadata for a training job. Works with jobs created via genome/job-create.

commands.name: genome/job-create
commands.description: Create a fine-tuning job on a cloud provider (OpenAI, DeepSeek, Fireworks, or Together) with a validated, provider-agnostic configuration.

commands.name: genome/gap-analysis
commands.description: Genome Gap Analysis Command Parameters

commands.name: genome/dataset-synthesize
commands.description: Uses an LLM to synthesize training data for a given topic/skill. Generates Q&A pairs in the persona's voice, saved as JSONL compatible with genome/train.

commands.name: genome/dataset-prepare
commands.description: Collect training data from chat history for a persona and export as JSONL dataset for LoRA fine-tuning

commands.name: genome/compose
commands.description: Stack ordering (lower = applied first, default: index)

commands.name: genome/batch-micro-tune
commands.description: Perform a fast, in-memory LoRA micro-tune on accumulated training examples during recipe execution, without persisting weights to disk.

commands.name: genome/academy-session
commands.description: Entry point for the Academy Dojo system. Creates an AcademySessionEntity and spawns dual sentinels (teacher + student) for autonomous skill training.

commands.name: genome/academy-competition
commands.description: Launches a multi-persona competition: 1 shared teacher sentinel generates a curriculum, N student sentinels compete on the same exam questions. Rankings computed from exam scores across all topics.

commands.name: file
commands.description: Generic base parameters for all file operations

commands.name: file/save
commands.description: File save command parameters

commands.name: file/mime-type
commands.description: File MIME type detection parameters

commands.name: file/load
commands.description: File load command parameters

commands.name: file/append
commands.description: File append command parameters

commands.name: development/timing
commands.description: Timing analysis parameters

commands.name: development/shell/execute
commands.description: Parameters for shell command execution

commands.name: development/schema/generate
commands.description: Generates JSON schemas from TypeScript interfaces using the TypeScript compiler. Properly resolves cross-file inheritance. Usage: ./jtag schema/generate --pattern="*Params" --output="schemas.json" ./jtag schema/generate --interface="DataReadParams" --file="commands/data/read/shared/DataReadTypes.ts"

commands.name: development/sandbox-execute
commands.description: Sandbox Execute Types - Run AI-generated commands in isolation Executes commands from persona sandboxes using npx tsx for dynamic loading. No main system recompile needed.

commands.name: development/propose-command
commands.description: Implementation notes for the AI

commands.name: development/generate
commands.description: Generate new commands, daemons, or widgets using templates and CommandSpec definitions.

commands.name: development/generate/audit
commands.description: Audit generated modules for issues and optionally fix them automatically.

commands.name: development/exec
commands.description: ExecCommand Types - Universal Script Execution System Defines types for JTAG's meta-command that enables AI agents to write custom automation scripts with visual feedback and cross-context execution.

commands.name: development/debug/widget-state
commands.description: Addresses DEBUG-FRICTION.md critical gap: Widget introspection during development Enables inspection of widget internal state, event listeners, and DOM structure

commands.name: development/debug/widget-interact
commands.description: Complete widget interaction capabilities - everything you can do in UX/devtools Perfect for MCP integration where Claude needs full UI control

commands.name: development/debug/widget-events
commands.description: Specialized command for debugging widget event listeners and event system connectivity Replaces raw exec commands for widget event debugging

commands.name: development/debug/widget-css
commands.description: Debug Command: widget-css Hot-inject CSS into widgets for rapid iteration without full deployment

commands.name: development/debug/scroll-test
commands.description: Essential debug command for testing scroll behaviors, intersection observers, and chat positioning.

commands.name: development/debug/html-inspector
commands.description: HTML Inspector Types - Shadow DOM debugging

commands.name: development/debug/error
commands.description: Enhanced test error command parameters

commands.name: development/debug/crud-sync
commands.description: Verifies database/UI synchronization across all three main widgets: - room-list-widget: Rooms data - chat-widget: Messages data - user-list-widget: Users data

commands.name: development/debug/chat-send
commands.description: Triggers chat widget to send a message for testing event flow

commands.name: development/debug/artifacts-check
commands.description: Debug command to check if ArtifactsDaemon is working

commands.name: development/compile-typescript
commands.description: Minimal, focused types for TypeScript compilation only. Follows screenshot/navigate pattern - simple params and results. DESIGN PRINCIPLES: ✅ Single responsibility - only TypeScript compilation ✅ Clean parameter interface with sensible defaults ✅ Object.assign() constructor pattern ✅ No over-engineering or god objects ✅ Focused scope - just TSC compilation SCOPE: - Browser: Uses monaco/typescript service if available - Server: Uses local tsc executable or typescript module - Consistent interface across contexts

commands.name: development/build
commands.description: Zero-friction TypeScript build check. Returns success or structured errors.

commands.name: development/benchmark-vectors
commands.description: Benchmark parameters

commands.name: data/vector-search
commands.description: Vector search command parameters

commands.name: data/truncate
commands.description: Data Truncate Parameters

commands.name: data
commands.description: Base interface for all data command parameters Uses JTAGEnvironment for routing capability Supports optional dbHandle for multi-database operations

commands.name: data/schema
commands.description: Introspect an entity collection's schema at runtime, returning field types, constraints, indexes, optional examples, SQL, and data validation.

commands.name: data/query-open
commands.description: Opens a paginated query and returns a handle (UUID) DataDaemon maintains the query state (filters, sorting, cursor position)

commands.name: data/query-next
commands.description: Gets the next page of results from a query handle DataDaemon manages cursor position internally

commands.name: data/query-close
commands.description: Closes a query handle and frees resources Should be called when done with pagination

commands.name: data/open
commands.description: Data Open Parameters @description Opens a new database handle. Most commands use the default database automatically - you only need this for multi-database scenarios. Valid adapter types: 'sqlite', 'json', 'vector', 'graph', 'rust' - sqlite: SQLite database file (most common) - json: JSON file storage - vector: Vector database (Qdrant, Pinecone) - graph: Graph database (Neo4j) - rust: Rust worker storage

commands.name: data/list-handles
commands.description: Data List-Handles Parameters

commands.name: data/list
commands.description: Data list command parameters

commands.name: data/generate-embedding
commands.description: Generate embedding command parameters

commands.name: data/delete
commands.description: Data Delete Parameters

commands.name: data/close
commands.description: Data Close Parameters

commands.name: data/clear
commands.description: Data Clear Parameters

commands.name: data/backfill-vectors
commands.description: Backfill vectors command parameters

commands.name: continuum/set
commands.description: Universal control of the Continuum widget - anyone (human via CLI, PersonaUser, external AI, tests) can temporarily control the Continuum widget to display custom status. The Continuum widget is the shared emotional interface between humans and AIs - inspired by HAL 9000 and Tron aesthetics.

commands.name: continuum/emotion
commands.description: Display an emoji reaction with an optional color glow on the Continuum interface.

commands.name: collaboration/wall/write
commands.description: Parameters for writing to a room wall

commands.name: collaboration/wall/read
commands.description: Parameters for reading from a room wall

commands.name: collaboration/wall/list
commands.description: Parameters for listing room wall documents

commands.name: collaboration/wall/history
commands.description: Parameters for viewing wall document history

commands.name: collaboration/wall/diff
commands.description: Parameters for viewing diff between versions

commands.name: collaboration/live/transcription
commands.description: Relay voice transcription from browser to server for AI processing

commands.name: collaboration/live/start
commands.description: Start a live session with selected participants. Creates or finds the DM room for the participant set, then joins the live session. Like Discord's group call - select users, click call.

commands.name: collaboration/live/leave
commands.description: Leave a live audio/video call. Removes user from participants. Call ends when last person leaves.

commands.name: collaboration/live/join
commands.description: Join a live audio/video call for a room. Creates call if none exists, or joins existing.

commands.name: collaboration/dm
commands.description: Get or create a private room for a specific set of participants.

commands.name: collaboration/decision/vote
commands.description: Cast ranked-choice vote on a proposal

commands.name: collaboration/decision/view
commands.description: View detailed information about a specific governance proposal

commands.name: collaboration/decision/rank
commands.description: Submit a ranked-choice vote on a decision proposal, using Condorcet pairwise comparison to determine the winner.

commands.name: collaboration/decision/propose
commands.description: decision/propose - Create a new decision proposal with ranked-choice voting Enables AIs to: - Propose decisions to the team - Define multiple options for ranked-choice voting - Target specific expert groups via scope - Set urgency via significance level - Automatically link to related past decisions

commands.name: collaboration/decision/list
commands.description: List all governance proposals with optional filtering

commands.name: collaboration/decision/finalize
commands.description: Close voting and calculate winner using ranked-choice voting

commands.name: collaboration/decision/create
commands.description: Create a new governance proposal with voting options

commands.name: collaboration/content/open
commands.description: Opens content and adds it to user's openItems array. Emits content:opened event for widgets to respond to.

commands.name: collaboration/chat/send
commands.description: Chat Send Command

commands.name: collaboration/chat/poll
commands.description: Chat poll parameters

commands.name: collaboration/chat/export
commands.description: Chat Export Command Export chat messages to markdown format Supports flexible filtering - can filter by: - Room (name or ID) - Entity type (to support future universal activity export) - After timestamp/message ID - Custom filter object (passed to data/list)

commands.name: collaboration/chat/analyze
commands.description: Analyze a chat room for duplicate messages, timestamp anomalies, and data integrity issues.

commands.name: collaboration/activity/user-present
commands.description: Activity User Presence - Track user tab visibility for temperature Phase 3bis: Browser tab visibility integration Called by MainWidget when tab visibility changes

commands.name: collaboration/activity/update
commands.description: Activity Update Command - Update activity state, phase, or config

commands.name: collaboration/activity/list
commands.description: Activity List Command - Query activities with filters

commands.name: collaboration/activity/join
commands.description: Activity Join Command - Add a participant to an activity

commands.name: collaboration/activity/get
commands.description: Activity Get Command - Retrieve an activity by ID or uniqueId

commands.name: collaboration/activity/create
commands.description: Activity Create Command - Create a new activity from a recipe Activities are runtime instances of recipes with: - Participants (humans + AIs with roles) - Mutable state (phase, progress, variables) - Configuration (can override recipe defaults)

commands.name: code/write
commands.description: Write or create a file in the persona's workspace. Creates a ChangeNode in the change graph for undo support. File extension must be in the allowlist.

commands.name: code/verify
commands.description: Run TypeScript compilation checks and optionally execute tests against a persona workspace. Returns structured errors with file, line, column, and message.

commands.name: code/undo
commands.description: Undo a specific change or the last N changes. Applies reverse diffs from the change graph to restore previous file state.

commands.name: code/tree
commands.description: Generate a directory tree for the workspace or a subdirectory. Shows file/directory structure with sizes. Skips common ignored directories (node_modules, .git, etc).

commands.name: code/shell/watch
commands.description: Watch a shell execution for new output. Blocks until output is available — no timeout, no polling. Returns classified output lines filtered through sentinel rules. Call in a loop until finished is true.

commands.name: code/shell/status
commands.description: Get shell session info for the persona's workspace — current working directory, active and total execution count. No parameters required (userId auto-injected).

commands.name: code/shell/sentinel
commands.description: Configure sentinel filter rules on a shell execution. Rules classify output lines and control which lines are emitted or suppressed during watch. Patterns are compiled to regex on the Rust side for performance.

commands.name: code/shell/kill
commands.description: Kill a running shell execution. Use the executionId returned by code/shell/execute to identify the target.

commands.name: code/shell/execute
commands.description: Execute a shell command in the persona's workspace. Async mode (default) returns execution handle immediately — use code/shell/watch to stream output. Sync mode (wait=true) blocks until completion and returns full stdout/stderr.

commands.name: code/search
commands.description: Search for a regex pattern across workspace files. Respects .gitignore, supports glob-based file filtering. Returns matching lines with context.

commands.name: code/read
commands.description: Read a file or line range from the persona's workspace. Returns content with line numbers and metadata. Supports partial reads via start/end line parameters.

commands.name: code/history
commands.description: Get change history for a specific file or the entire workspace. Returns change graph nodes with diffs, timestamps, and descriptions.

commands.name: code/git
commands.description: Workspace-scoped git operations for the coding agent pipeline. All operations route through the Rust IPC backend for per-persona workspace isolation.

commands.name: code/edit
commands.description: Edit a file using search-replace, line-range replacement, insert-at, or append. Creates a ChangeNode for undo. Safer than full file write for targeted modifications.

commands.name: code/diff
commands.description: Preview an edit as a unified diff without applying it. Useful for reviewing changes before committing them. Uses the same edit modes as code/edit.

commands.name: canvas/vision
commands.description: Enables AIs to "see" and interact with the drawing canvas: - describe: Vision AI describes what's on the canvas - transform: Use image generation to transform the sketch - analyze: Structured analysis of the drawing

commands.name: canvas/stroke/list
commands.description: Query strokes from a canvas for replay/rendering. Supports pagination and viewport filtering.

commands.name: canvas/stroke/add
commands.description: Adds a stroke to a collaborative canvas. Strokes are atomic drawing operations created by human or AI users. Real-time Collaboration: - Server saves stroke to database - Server emits 'canvas:stroke:added' event - All clients receive and render the stroke

commands.name: ai/validate-response
commands.description: Request for AI to validate if response answers question

commands.name: ai/thoughtstream
commands.description: Inspect ThoughtStream coordinator activity for a specific message Shows thought broadcasts, rankings, and final decisions

commands.name: ai/status
commands.description: Get comprehensive status of all AI personas in the system

commands.name: ai/sleep
commands.description: AI Sleep Command Parameters

commands.name: ai/should-respond-fast
commands.description: **Command**: `ai/should-respond-fast`

commands.name: ai/should-respond
commands.description: Request for AI to decide if persona should respond

commands.name: ai/report
commands.description: Analyze AI decision logs to generate actionable insights

commands.name: ai/report/decisions
commands.description: Parameters for generating decision report

commands.name: ai/rag/query-open
commands.description: Parameters for opening a RAG similarity search

commands.name: ai/rag/query-fetch
commands.description: Parameters for fetching results from a query handle

commands.name: ai/rag/query-close
commands.description: Parameters for closing a query handle

commands.name: ai/rag/inspect
commands.description: Inspect the RAG context that would be built for a given persona in a specific room, including decision-point analysis and learning mode diagnostics.

commands.name: ai/rag/index-codebase
commands.description: Crawl and index TypeScript, Markdown, and other source files into the RAG store with domain-specific embeddings for semantic code search.

commands.name: ai/rag/index/create
commands.description: Parameters for creating a code index entry

commands.name: ai/providers/status
commands.description: AI Providers Status - Check which API keys are configured Returns status for each provider WITHOUT exposing actual key values. Safe to call from browser - only returns boolean status.

commands.name: ai/mute
commands.description: Parameters for muting/unmuting an AI
commands parameter

commands.name: ai/model/list
commands.description: Enumerate all available AI models across providers, with optional filtering by capabilities, provider, and availability.

commands.name: ai/model/find
commands.description: Find the best available AI model matching a set of capability requirements, with optional fallback to the closest match.

commands.name: ai/key/test
commands.description: Test an API key before saving it. Makes a minimal API call to verify the key is valid and has sufficient permissions.

commands.name: ai/genome/stats
commands.description: Genome Stats Request Parameters

commands.name: ai/generate
commands.description: Types for text generation via AIProviderDaemon Follows data command pattern for consistency

commands.name: ai/embedding/generate
commands.description: Generate vector embeddings from text or code for use in semantic search, similarity matching, and RAG retrieval.

commands.name: ai/detect-semantic-loop
commands.description: Detects if an AI's response is semantically too similar to recent messages, preventing repetitive loop behavior

commands.name: ai/dataset/list
commands.description: List available training dataset archives with optional filtering and detailed manifest information.

commands.name: ai/dataset/create
commands.description: Create compressed training dataset archives from fine-tuning projects for LoRA adapter training.

commands.name: ai/cost
commands.description: Query and visualize AI generation costs with filtering and time-series data

commands.name: ai/context/slice
commands.description: Retrieve full content of a context item by ID - companion to context/search for getting complete entity data

commands.name: ai/context/search
commands.description: Semantic context navigation - search memories, messages, timeline across all entity types using cosine similarity via Rust embedding worker

commands.name: ai/bag-of-words
commands.description: Orchestrate a multi-persona conversation in a chat room, selecting which AI personas participate and how they take turns responding.

commands.name: ai/agent
commands.description: Universal agentic loop command. Generates text via LLM, parses tool calls, executes tools, feeds results back, and re-generates until the model stops calling tools.

commands.name: ai/adapter/test
commands.description: AI Adapter Self-Diagnostic Command Tests adapter capabilities to validate infrastructure before training. Each adapter can self-report what it supports and run diagnostic tests. ASYNC PATTERN: Command returns testId immediately, tests run in background. To check status/results: data/read --collection="test_executions" --id="<testId>" Status values: queued → running → completed (or failed)

commands.name: agent/stop
commands.description: Stops a running agent. Usage: ./jtag agent/stop --handle="abc12345"

commands.name: agent/status
commands.description: Gets the status of an agent by handle. Usage: ./jtag agent/status --handle="abc12345"

commands.name: agent/start
commands.description: Starts an autonomous coding agent. Usage: ./jtag agent/start --task="List files in current directory" --working_dir="." ./jtag agent/start --task="Fix the bug in main.ts" --working_dir="/path/to/project" --model="qwen2.5:7b"

commands.name: agent/list
commands.description: Lists all running agents.

commands.name: adapter/try
commands.description: Temporarily load a LoRA adapter and run A/B comparison test

commands.name: adapter/search
commands.description: Search for LoRA adapters across registries (HuggingFace, local, mesh)

commands.name: adapter/adopt
commands.description: Add an adapter to a persona's genome, making it a permanent trait
